meanings.definition: The state of being unfit or unsafe for driving on the road.
meanings.sent1: The unroadworthiness of the old car made it dangerous to drive.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic identified the unroadworthiness of the vehicle due to its faulty brakes.
meanings.sent3: Despite its unroadworthiness, the car managed to chug along the bumpy road.
meanings.sent4: The unroadworthiness of the vehicle was like a red flag warning of imminent danger.
meanings.sent5: The unroadworthiness of the car was so severe that it was deemed a hazard on wheels.

meanings.definition: The quality of not meeting the necessary standards for road safety.
meanings.sent1: The unroadworthiness of the bridge led to its closure for repairs.
meanings.sent2: Road authorities take strict action against vehicles with unroadworthiness issues.
meanings.sent3: The unroadworthiness of the road sign caused confusion among drivers.
meanings.sent4: The unroadworthiness of the traffic lights resulted in chaos at the intersection.
meanings.sent5: The unroadworthiness of the road surface posed a risk to all who traveled on it.
